com.st.st25sdk.command

Class Type4Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.command.Type4Command
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Type4CommandInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Type4CustomCommand

    public class Type4Command
extends java.lang.Object
implements Type4CommandInterface
    Defines methods to build all the NFC Forum Type4 commands

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock mLock
      Java lock to make sure Type4 commands are sent in an atomic manner
      protected int mMaxReadSizeInBytes 
      protected int mMaxWriteSizeInBytes 
      protected RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode transceiveMode 
      static byte TYPE4_CMD_FIRST_OR_ONLY_OCCURENCE
      Type4 select first or only occurence parameter code

      Type4 read binary instruction code

      Type4 select instruction code

      Type4 select by file ID parameter code
      static byte TYPE4_CMD_SELECT_BY_NAME
      Type4 select by file name parameter code
      static byte TYPE4_CMD_UPDATE_BINARY
      Type4 update binary instruction code
      static int TYPE4_HEADER_SIZE
      Size of frame containing class (1byte) instruction command (1byte) p1,p2 (2 bytes)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxCApduDataSize()
      This function returns the max data size that can be sent to the Type 4 Tag in bytes

      This function returns the max data size that can be read from the Type 4 Tag in bytes
      byte[] readBinary(byte p1, byte p2, byte length)
      Read binary command, used to read data from the selected file

      Select a file by fileId

      Type 4 NDEF Tag Application mapping version 2 select command
      byte[] selectNdefTagApplicationMappingVersion1()
      Type 4 NDEF Tag Application mapping version 1 select command
      byte[] selectNdefTagApplicationMappingVersion2()
      Type 4 NDEF Tag Application mapping version 2 select command
      byte[] selectNdefTagApplicationSequence()
      Successive commands to select the NDEF TAG Application Send NDEF TAG Application (NFC Forum mapping version 2), then NDEF TAG Application (NFC Forum mapping version 1) if MV2 not supported
      void setMaxCApduDataSize(int sizeInBytes)
      This function sets the max data size that can be sent to the Type 4 Tag We will take the most restrictive value between: - the reader's constraint (obtained from getMaxTransceiveLength()) - the tag's constraint
      void setMaxRApduDataSize(int sizeInBytes)
      This function sets the max data size that can be read from the Type 4 Tag We will take the most restrictive value between: - the reader's constraint (obtained from getMaxTransceiveLength()) - the tag's constraint
      byte[] transceive(java.lang.String commandName, byte[] data)
      Sends the RF frame to the reader and checks the command status If transceiMode is set as iso14443-A transparent mode, the RF frame response is sent as it, event id Tag send back an error code
      byte[] updateBinary(byte p1, byte p2, byte[] data)
      Update Binary command, used to write data to the selected file
      void writeData(int fileOffset, byte[] data)
      Write some data to the currently selected file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Type4Command

        public Type4Command(RFReaderInterface reader,
                    int maxRApduSize,
                    int maxCApduSize)
        Constructor for a Type4Command object
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader interface object to be used to send the commands
        maxRApduSize - the maximum R-APDU size (in bytes)
        maxCApduSize - the maximum C-APDU size (in bytes)

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxRApduDataSize

        public void setMaxRApduDataSize(int sizeInBytes)
        This function sets the max data size that can be read from the Type 4 Tag We will take the most restrictive value between: - the reader's constraint (obtained from getMaxTransceiveLength()) - the tag's constraint
        Parameters:
        sizeInBytes - Maximum number of bytes for R-APDU

      • setMaxCApduDataSize

        public void setMaxCApduDataSize(int sizeInBytes)
        This function sets the max data size that can be sent to the Type 4 Tag We will take the most restrictive value between: - the reader's constraint (obtained from getMaxTransceiveLength()) - the tag's constraint
        Parameters:
        sizeInBytes - Maximum number of bytes for C-APDU

      • getMaxRApduDataSize

        public int getMaxRApduDataSize()
        This function returns the max data size that can be read from the Type 4 Tag in bytes
        Returns:
        the maximum number of bytes that can be read by a command

      • getMaxCApduDataSize

        public int getMaxCApduDataSize()
        This function returns the max data size that can be sent to the Type 4 Tag in bytes
        Returns:
        the maximum number of bytes for a C-APDU

        Specified by:

                       int sizeInBytes)

        Returns:

      • writeData

        public void writeData(int fileOffset,
                      byte[] data)
               throws STException
        Write some data to the currently selected file. Data are written at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        fileOffset - Offset in currently selected file
        data - data to write
        Throws:
        STException

      • transceive

        public byte[] transceive(java.lang.String commandName,
                         byte[] data)
                  throws STException
        Sends the RF frame to the reader and checks the command status If transceiMode is set as iso14443-A transparent mode, the RF frame response is sent as it, event id Tag send back an error code
        Parameters:
        commandName - name of the command
        data - the RF frame to be sent
        Returns:
        the RF response frame sent back by the tag
        Throws:
        STException
